description:
The anime is set in Bayron City, an artificial island city established, outside of any country's jurisdiction, in the Pacific Ocean to exploit local natural resources. In particular, the mining of the new energy resource orgonium has resulted in an outbreak of "D disasters" by demons in the city. Private military companies (PMCs) are tasked with dealing with these incidents.

The protagonist Shuu runs a small PMC, though his spending habits have left him constantly penniless. A demon girl named Kisara does contract work at Shuu's office and is constantly worried for him. Kisara attends a high school in Bayron City, and does everything from clerical work to household chores with confidence. Meanwhile, Ayano is Shuu's ex-girlfriend, an elite agent, and a former work colleague in a major PMC that Shuu used to work for.

(Source: Anime News Network, edited)

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

He is the original scenario writer for the visual novel White Album 2.

He is the original scenario writer for the visual novel White Album 2.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/p1b9f44vegyae8n)

Affiliated with [Dangun Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6521/). Initially worked as a production assistant.

His work on the 34th episode of [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/) attracted a lot of attention within the industry, as well as his more recent work in [Sword Art Online: Alicization](https://anilist.co/anime/100182/), in which he mostly teamed-up with [Kentarou Waki](https://anilist.co/staff/146156/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/151679259) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=1304769)

A freelance designer. He hasn't been active as an animator in over a decade.

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

__Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube__ Introduction: Halca is a Japanese musician affiliated with company Music Ray'n and signed to label Sacra Music. She had a major appearance as the opening act during the CHiCO with HoneyWorks 2017 tour. In 2018 she released her first single called "Kimi no Tonari", which was used as the ending theme for the anime "Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku". Her other appearances have been in anime such as: Ace Attorney, Kaguya-sama: Love is War and We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2 Biography: Halca started with an interest in music from early childhood. She was heavily inspired when she one day received a copy of the song "Again" by YUI. While in junior high school, she discovered that her home's cable TV had an anime channel, which is also the way she became familiar with anime music in general. She would watch this anime channel on a daily basis, which slowly began to impact her future plans. The biggest impact from the several anime shows she watched in her childhood, were shows such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Toradora!. The anime that had the biggest musical influence ended up being the song "Kiss Kara Hajimaru Miracle" from the anime Steel Angel Kurumi, which became her favorite anime song. She decided to join her school's choir club and broadcast theater club later on to hone her vocal skills, as she started to take an approach to singing herself. After honing her skills in school she officially decided to pursue a career as a musician. Halca had a lot of singing auditions to consider, but the audition that piqued her interest the most was for the Utakatsu! Audition, which focused on anime songs. She decided to participate in the audition for Utakatsu!, and she ended up winning the grand prize in 2013. She didn't let win go to her head, however, as after the winning the audition she continued to train her vocal skills while waiting to make her major debut. In 2017 she was invited by the singer CHiCO, known primarily for her involvement in the group HoneyWorks (alongside Gom, Shito and Yamako), to perform in the latter's 2017 live tour as their opening act. Following her opening act, she performed the song "Kimi no Sora" ("Your Sky"), which was included in a compilation album released to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the online novel publisher Noichigo. She also performed with the song "Resonator", which was used in the original soundtrack for the anime series "Beatless", and she also made a mini-album titled White Disc, which was sold during the HoneyWorks tour. Halca made her major debut later in 2018, with the release of her first single "Kimi no Tonari" ("Next to You"), which was used as the ending theme for the anime Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku. To commemorate the release of her first single, the mini-album White Disc was made available for sale during the single's release event. Her second single "Starting Blue" was released in October 2018, with the title track being used as the ending theme for the second season of the anime Ace Attorney. Her third single "Sentimental Crisis" was released in February 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme for the anime Kaguya-sama: Love is War. Her fourth single "Houkago no Liberty" was released on November 13, 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme to the anime We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2. (Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halca), edited)
